page.title: 14Gravel Objections, Bridgham
page.content:
The grounds for Bridgham's strongest objections to the gravel extraction proposal (see page 13) are:
- that our quiet village would be completely ruined by the dirt, dust, traffic, noise and vibration of this huge industrial intrusion; - that the forest amenity would be ruined for us and for holidaymakers by constant use of Forest Track 76 by gravel lorries and that footpaths and campsites would be lost; - that forest and river wildlife would be destroyed by noise, traffic and pollution; - that the village would never be free of extraction, for deposits are more extensive than initially indicated; - that regional gravel supplies are already adequate.
